mdRecord.dcterms:title: A new and historical map of Albemarle County, Virginia / by Frank A. Massie
Map of Albemarle County, Virginia
Massie map
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Massie, Frank A.
Virginia School Company.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Owned and published by the Virginia School Company
mdRecord.dcterms:extent: 112 x 103 cm. on sheet 153 x 108 cm. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Map gives centerpoint location: Longitude W. of Washington, 1⁰28'; W. of Greenwich, 78⁰30'. Latitude, 38⁰.
Inset: Junction rail road map of Virginia, also showing relative position of Albemarle Co. in the state.
Includes statistics for Albemarle County and Charlottesville for 1906; population figures for 1900.
Contains geographic and geological features, roads, railroads, telephone lines, post offices, voting places, schools, churches, historic sites, and homes of many county residents.
On some copies, the county border has been outlined in pink. One copy has additional places of interest written in.
Commonly referred to as the Massie map.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 1-3: With border outlined in pink. MYLARED, ROLLED, AND SHELVED IN ELEPHANT FOLIOS RANGE 4.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 4: With additional places of interest written in.

SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 5: With border outlined in pink, mounted on linen. Possibly from the library of Jed Hotchkiss ("Hotchkiss-C?" on Area table card). Folded; shelved in MAP CASES. IN VERY POOR CONDITION: USE ONE OF THE ROLLED COPIES.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 6: Negative photostat, in seventeen sections. Shelved in FLAT MAP BOX
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Copy 7: Blue line print; date of production unknown.
